translation.safe_birth_tag_line: UNFPA’s campaign to end maternal death in humanitarian and fragile settings
translation.opening_tag_line:
Every 2 minutes,
a woman dies giving birth.
translation.scroll_message: Scroll or use arrow keys whenever this indicator appears
translation.privacy_message: Privacy policy and Terms of Use
translation.clock_text: This clock will track the number of women who die giving birth while you are on the site.
translation.maps_main_title1: Maternal deaths are not evenly distributed around the world.
translation.maps_main_title2: Over half of maternal deaths occur in countries affected by humanitarian crises or fragility.
translation.maps_second_slide_text: More than half of maternal deaths occur in countries affected by humanitarian crises or fragility.
translation.maps_second_slide_bottom_text2: Areas affected by humanitarian crisis or fragile situations, as of
translation.young_mother_in_south_sudan:
Young mother in South Sudan
© UNFPA South Sudan/Bruno Feder
translation.coutnry_wise_comparison_text: is {{story_number}} times more likely to die in childbirth than a woman in {{location_name}}
translation.coutnry_wise_comparison_text_1: is {{story_number}} times more likely to die giving birth than a woman in {{user_location}}, the country with the world's lowest maternal mortality.
translation.double_tap_on_the_map_for_zoom: Double tap on the map for zoom
translation.map_popup_sharing_content: Maternal deaths are not evenly distributed around the world. Find out how conflict and disaster, crisis and poverty threaten pregnant women’s lives, and join @UNFPA to support #SafeBirth even in the most challenging circumstances: safebirthevenhere.org
translation.i_stand_with_unfpa_to_end_maternal_death: I stand with UNFPA to end maternal deaths. Each of us can make a difference by raising awareness about a pregnant woman’s right to a #SafeBirth, no matter where she lives.
translation.popup_action_component_text:
While you've been here
{{women}} {{counter_description}} died in childbirth.
translation.after_the_earthquake: After the earthquake in Haiti, Iloyese’s cousin couldn’t find a doctor to help her give birth
translation.when_her_own_time_came_iloyese_had_to_tr: When her own time came, Iloyese had to travel 4 hours to get to a clinic to give birth.
translation.midwife_stephanie_roche_hands_gloved_to_: Midwife  Stephanie  Roche, hands gloved to protect her patient from infection, prepares to attend to a delivery at  Marigot Maternal Health Centre   clinic in  Marigot, Haiti.
translation.iloyese_rests_at_the_clinic_with_her_new: Iloyese  rests at the clinic with her newborn. When she finally got to the clinic, “I met Ms. Roche and liked her a lot, because of the way she serves and interacts with the women.”
translation.the_clinic_in_marigot_also_serves_women_: The clinic in  Marigot  also serves women who, like Iloyese, have to travel from afar to get the care they need. “The problem of access,” says midwife Roche, “It is a huge challenge, even now.”
translation.in_addition_to_providing_services_matern: In addition to providing services, maternal health clinics can offer information and counselling that help women and girls make informed decisions and stay healthy and safe.
translation.beyond_delivering_babies_maternal_health: Beyond delivering babies, maternal health clinics also provide a range of services – from antenatal care to family planning to HIV testing – that are critical for sexual and reproductive health.
translation.for_midwife_roche_the_best_part_of_her_j: For midwife Roche, the best part of her job happens in the delivery room. “The woman has been waiting for her baby,” she says, “so have we. So for me, that is the best moment.”
translation.unfpa_with_support_from_johnson_johnson_: UNFPA, with support from Johnson & Johnson, is working to strengthen midwifery in Haiti. And thanks to the work of midwives like Ms. Roche, maternal deaths are falling by 2.2 per cent each year. “Midwives give life,” she says.
translation.she_made_it_and_delivered_her_baby_with_: She made it, and delivered her baby with the help of midwife Stephanie Roche.
She made it, and delivered her baby with the help of midwife Stefani Roche.
translation.most_maternal_deaths_can_be_prevented_wi: Most maternal deaths can be prevented with skilled care before, during and after delivery.
translation.with_support_from_johnson_johnson_unfpa_: With support from Johnson & Johnson, UNFPA is working to equip midwives with the skills they need to ensure safe birth.
translation.what_if_you_were_in_labour_but_the_neare: What if you were in labour, but the nearest clinic was 4 hours away? One woman in Haiti recounts her journey to secure a #SafeBirth for herself and her baby: safebirthevenhere.org
translation.i_can_work_to_save_my_people: I can work to save my people.
translation.yamah_a_midwife_and_supervisor_of_a_mate: Yamah, a midwife and supervisor of a maternal health clinic
translation.midwife_and_clinic_supervisor_yamah_risk: Midwife and clinic supervisor Yamah risked her own life to deliver babies during the Ebola outbreak.
translation.the_epidemic_devastated_liberias_fragile:
The epidemic devastated Liberia’s fragile healthcare system.
Maternal deaths surged.
translation.but_even_here_midwives_like_yamah_persev: But even here, midwives like Yamah persevered in tending to mothers and their newborns.
translation.clinic_supervisor_yamah_siafa_set_an_exa: Clinic supervisor Yamah Siafa set an example for her fellow midwives during the Ebola outbreak, going in to treat patients when others were too scared. Over 400 doctors and nurses died while treating patients during the epidemic.
translation.midwife_georgetta_gbelly_sits_with_patie: Midwife  Georgetta Gbelly   sits with patients at   the UNFPA-supported Sinje Health Centre clinic in  Grand Cape Mount County, Liberia. During the outbreak, many pregnant women stopped going to clinics out of fear of catching Ebola, and mortality rose as more birth complications went untreated.
translation.maternal_mortality_is_higher_among_poor_: Maternal mortality is higher among poor women worldwide. In Liberia, the poorest women are less than half as likely as the richest to have a skilled attendant help them deliver their babies.
translation.midwife_gbelly_takes_a_moment_to_fill_ou: Midwife  Gbelly  takes a moment to fill out paperwork. UNFPA, with funding from Johnson & Johnson, is supporting Liberia to expand and train its midwifery workforce.
translation.liberia_is_one_of_the_focus_countries_fo: Liberia is one of the focus countries for UNFPA’s provision of essential medicines and supplies for safe delivery and other maternal health needs.
translation.midwife_gbelly_hands_21yearold_bendu_her: Midwife  Gbelly  hands 21-year-old Bendu her newborn daughter. After the baby is delivered, midwives provide post-natal care and support to new mothers.
translation.midwives_save_lives_sometimes_risking_th: Midwives save lives, sometimes risking their own in the process. See how midwives in Liberia endeavoured to make #SafeBirth possible during the Ebola epidemic: safebirthevenhere.org
translation.i_was_sure_i_was_going_to_die_unless_i_g: “I was sure I was going to die, unless I got help.”
translation.lena_was_alone_in_the_wilderness_when_he: Lena was alone in the wilderness when her labour started.
translation.hours_earlier_she_had_awoken_to_the_soun: Hours earlier, she had awoken to the sound of gunshots – and then her house was on fire. Cattle rustlers were attacking her community.
translation.i_remember_shouting_at_my_children_to_ru: “I remember shouting at my children to run into the nearby bush.”
translation.when_she_fled_lena_grabbed_just_one_thin: When she fled, Lena grabbed just one thing: a plastic bag containing her personal items and a UNFPA clean delivery kit.
translation.when_lena_cried_out_in_the_dark_her_neig: When Lena cried out in the dark, her neighbour heard and came to help. She delivered Lena’s baby boy – using the kit to keep mother and baby safe from infection.
translation.that_i_believe_is_what_saved_my_life: That, I believe, is what saved my life.
translation.unfpa_clean_delivery_kits_contain_simple: UNFPA clean delivery kits contain simple items that can make a difference between life and death.
translation.a_plastic_sheet_provides_a_clean_surface: A plastic sheet provides a clean surface for the mother to lie on during delivery.
translation.soap_and_sterile_gloves_ensure_the_birth: Soap and sterile gloves ensure the birth attendant has clean hands – and during childbirth, clean hands save lives.
translation.a_fresh_razor_blade_antiseptic_and_cord_: A fresh razor blade, antiseptic and cord ties reduce the risk of infection when cutting the baby’s umbilical cord.
translation.a_clean_cloth_to_wrap_the_baby_keeps_her: A clean cloth to wrap the baby keeps her warm during the vulnerable time right after birth.
translation.even_the_plastic_bag_the_kit_comes_in_ha: Even the plastic bag the kit comes in has an important use – it provides a hygienic container to dispose of the placenta.
translation.unfpa_distributes_clean_delivery_kits_to: UNFPA distributes clean delivery kits to pregnant women who may lack sterile birthing conditions. These low-cost interventions can prevent maternal deaths.
translation.how_can_a_razor_blade_a_plastic_sheet_an: How can a razor blade, a plastic sheet and some disposable gloves save two lives? Find out at safebirthevenhere.org and join @UNFPA to support #SafeBirth.
translation.while_youve_been_here_rootwomen_counterd: While you´ve been here, {{root_women}} {{counter_description}} died giving birth
translation.contribute_to_help_fund_the_lifesaving_w: Contribute to help fund the lifesaving work of midwives and provide clean delivery kits that protect women during childbirth.
translation.stand_with_unfpa_to_end_maternal_deaths: Stand with UNFPA to end maternal deaths.
translation.raise_awareness_of_every_pregnant_womans: Raise awareness of every pregnant woman’s right to a safe birth.
translation.this_website_was_developed_with_support_: This website was developed with support from Johnson & Johnson. Safe Birth Even Here is a UNFPA initiative to ensure that women have what they need to deliver their babies safely, even in humanitarian crises and fragile situations.
translation.every_day_over_830_women_die_giving_birt: Every day, over 830 women die giving birth – more than one every two minutes. Join @UNFPA to support #SafeBirth: safebirthevenhere.org
translation.i_stand_with_unfpa_to_end_maternal_death: I stand with @UNFPA to end maternal deaths. Each of us can make a difference by raising awareness about a pregnant woman’s right to a #SafeBirth, no matter where she lives: safebirthevenhere.org
translation.every_two_minutes_a_woman_dies_giving_bi: Every two minutes, a woman dies giving birth. You can support #SafeBirth and help @UNFPA stop the clock. Find out how here: safebirthevenhere.org
translation.every_day_over_830_women_die_giving_birt: Every day, over 830 women die giving birth – more than one every two minutes. Most could have been saved. Join @UNFPA to support #SafeBirth: safebirthevenhere.org
